title: hallucination
body:
A condition where something is perceived when it doesn't actually exist in reality. Hallucinations are often a symptom of mental illnesses.

h4.External Links
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hallucination]

title: illusion
body: A phenomenon in which a person perceives something different from what is actually there, even though there is nothing wrong with the sensory organs. It is distinguished from a [[hallucination]], in which a non-existent object is thought to exist.

title: scrapper_(transformers)
body:
A character from the [[Transformers]] [[science fiction]] franchise.

[b]Scrapper[/b] is an evil [i][[Constructicon]][/i] [[Decepticon]], a sentient green, grey and black [[alien]] [[robot]] that can transform into a bright green wheeled payloader [[truck]] with some resemblance to a Caterpillar CAT 966C.

Scrapper is the leader of the Constructions.

Motto: [i]"My work is a monument to -and made of- my enemies...".[/i]

title: pile_bunker
body:
A fictional melee [[weapon]]. Its first appearance was in [[Soukou Kihei Votoms]]. An armor-piercing spike just like a pile driver hammered into enemy's armor plate by an explosive charge or electrical power. Other Pilebunker weapons require a [[bullet]] to use its exceed force and eject the shell casing from said weapon.

title: vincent_(fnaf_au)
body:
The identity of the Purple Man/[[William Afton]] in Rebornica's [i][[Five Nights at Freddy's]][/i] early illustrations. 

Depictions of the Vincent variation of Purple Man often include a lanky figure, a [[low ponytail]], and empty [[white eyes]]. While Vincent was originally drawn with a [[goatee]] and as fully purple, some fanart do without either.

The character design was later retooled into the player character of [i]Night Terror[/i], a videogame in Rebornica's later webcomic [i]Pilot[/i].

title: asymmetrical_one-piece_swimsuit
body:
A [[one-piece swimsuit]] with an asymmetrical design.

One very common asymmetrical design is a one-piece with only one shoulder strap. This is known as a [i]"one shoulder"[/i] swimsuit. Other examples include one side of the swimsuit solely having cutouts, a single diagonal strap link, or one side made out of straps.

Colors, patterns and [[print swimsuit]]s does not count as "asymmetrical design." Use [[two-tone one-piece swimsuit]] instead.

title: sol_badguy
body:
Main character from [[Guilty Gear]] and a rival of [[Ky Kiske]]. He is also known as "The Immoral Flame". He is an aloof bounty hunter who is overly blunt and easily annoyed. However, deep down in heart, he is not a bad person. He is a fan of the rock band [[Queen (band)|]] and enjoys listening to their music, which inspired the series' hard rock and heavy metal soundtrack.

He is, in fact, [spoiler][[Dizzy (Guilty Gear)|]]'s father conceived with [[Justice (Guilty Gear)|]], which makes him Ky's father-in-law and [[Sin Kiske]]'s grandfather. Neither Sol nor Ky took this revelation well once they realized it.[/spoiler]

title: ky_kiske
body:
[[Sol Badguy]]'s rival and the other main character from the [[Guilty Gear]] series. He is the former leader of the Sacred Order of Holy Knights and is the chief of the International Police Force. He is dedicated to God and works to maintain peace after the holy war. Although he morally sees only in black and white and not in shades of grey, and is easily manipulated by unseen workers from the holy war, he is working to adjust.

By [[Guilty Gear 2]], he has been elected High King of Illyria, became the husband of [[Dizzy (Guilty Gear)|]] and fathered a son; [[Sin Kiske]].

title: sin_kiske
body:
A character from the [[Guilty Gear]] series and the son of [[Ky Kiske]] and [[Dizzy (Guilty Gear)|]]. Due to being one-quarter Gear, Sin is fully grown by the age of three, but is still emotionally immature. He travels with [[Sol Badguy]], who has become a grudging mentor to Sin.

He uses a flag and pole as a weapon and has a massive appetite.

title: crying_child's_brother_(fnaf)
body:
The teenage older brother of the [[Crying Child (fnaf)|]] in [i][[Five Nights at Freddy's 4]][/i]. A mean-spirited prankster and a bully to the Child, who sometimes gets his friends to join in on the humiliation. [spoiler]He and his friends are ultimately responsible for the Child's head injury when they shoved the Child's head into the mouth of a Fredbear animatronic. The brother is at least remorseful for this.[/spoiler]

Fans speculate that the brother is actually [[Michael Afton]].

title: shimura_shinpachi
body:
A [i][[Gintama]][/i] character. One of the heirs to the Shimura clan dojo and the younger brother of [[Shimura Tae]]. The series tsukkomi. Most jokes about him center around his [[glasses]] being his most memorable trait. Works in the Yorozuya with [[Sakata Gintoki]] and [[Kagura (gintama)|]]. Knew [[Obi Hajime]] in his youth.

Actually loosely based off of the [[Shinsengumi]] captain [[Nagakura Shinpachi]], but while he is affiliated with his series' [[shinsengumi (gintama)|equivalent]] to them, he is not a member of the organization.

title: qui-gon_jinn
body:
Qui-Gon Jinn is a character from the [[Star Wars]] saga, played by Liam Neeson. He is a main character in the prequel film trilogy, serving as one of the protagonists of [[Star Wars: The Phantom Menace| The Phantom Menace]] (1999).

[spoiler]During the Battle of Naboo, Qui-Gon and his padawan [[Obi-Wan Kenobi]] confronted the [[sith]] [[Darth Maul]] together. While they initially managed to fend off the Sith Lord, Maul kills Qui-Gon.[/spoiler]

title: monster_girl_saga
body:
A combination of isekai and harem story, written by Anonymoose and based in the world of monster girl encyclopedia. It revolves around the main character being "magically transported to a world of miracles and magic, full of all manner of creatures from folklore that have metamorphosed into beautiful women for reasons unknown, where a great conflict is brewing between the newly-crowned Monster Lord, and the old "order," who wish to eliminate the monsters and return the world to its pre-metamorphosis state."

MGS is best known for its extreme length- the story has been written continuously for a decade, and is now seven volumes long (over 120 chapters.) It can be read here: http://anonymoosesaga.pbworks.com/w/page/67867177/Introduction

In [[Fire Emblem: Thracia 776]], it is revealed that he is engaged to [[Linoan (Fire Emblem)|]], a woman from Tahra.

He bears a strong resemblance to his father, having [[long hair|long]], [[green hair]], a [[black_coat]] with two large [[pauldrons]], and a [[two-tone cape]] that is black on the outside and red on the inside.

title: ced_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Ced[/b] (セティ, [i]Sety[/i]) is a character from the second generation of [[Fire Emblem: Genealogy of the Holy War]], and appears in [[Fire Emblem: Thracia 776]] as an endgame ally. The son of [[Erinys (Fire Emblem)|Erinys]] and brother of [[Fee (Fire Emblem)|Fee]], Ced is renowned throughout Munster as a hero who will save the land from King Bloom's tyrannical regime.

[[Fire Emblem: Thracia 776|Thracia 776]] canonized Ced as the son of [[Lewyn (Fire Emblem)|Prince Lewyn]], making him a full-blooded descendant of the Crusader for which he was named, the crown prince of Silesse, and the inheritor of the [[Forseti (tome)|Book of Forseti]].

title: thorn_(destiny)
body:
An exotic [[revolver|Hand Cannon]] from [[Destiny (game)|Destiny 2]].

Formerly [[Rose (Destiny)|]], and one of the Hive's Weapons of Sorrow, Thorn was the weapon of choice by the corrupted Rezyl Azzir, now known as Dredgen Yor. Powered by Hive magic and forever hungering for Light, it was capable of permanently killing Guardians as if they were anyone else, and could devour the souls of those who fell to it to fuel its wielder.

After Yor was slain by Shin Malphur, the weapon would find itself in the hands of the player character, who would go on to purify it back into Rose, and eventually transform it into [[Lumina (Destiny)|]].

[i]"To rend one's enemies is to see them not as equals, but objects—hollow of spirit and meaning."

title: rose_(destiny)
body:
A legendary [[revolver|Hand Cannon]] in [[Destiny (Game)|Destiny 2]].

Once owned by former paragon of Guardians in the Dark Age, Rezyl Azzir. It was his signature Hand Cannon, before Azzir would become corrupted by the influence of the Hive through Xyor, the Unwed. As he became corrupted, so did his Hand Cannon, later becoming [[Thorn (Destiny)|]].

[i]"In his strong hand the man held a Rose. And his aura burned bright."

title: lumina_(destiny)
body:
An exotic [[revolver|Hand Cannon]] from [[Destiny (game)|Destiny 2]].

A purified version of former Guardian Rezyl Azzir's [[Rose (Destiny)|]], the Lumina serves as the antithesis of [[Thorn (Destiny)|]]. Whereas Thorn devoured souls to grant itself power, Lumina absolves souls to share its power with others. It was forged by the Light of the player character, and serves as a testament to what the Light represents: A new beginning, and the proof that "nothing ends":[https://www.ishtar-collective.net/categories/book-nothing-ends].

[i]"There must be meaning in my roar."

title: ventriloquism
body:
The art of "channeling" one's voice through an inanimate object at hand such as a [[puppet]], [[doll]], or [[stuffed toy]], making it seem that it is talking. For this effect, the performer keeps their mouth superficially closed with minimal movement, but keeping it slightly open for the voice to remain clear and not muffled, all the while moving the object to show it seemingly speaking.

The Japanese term [i]fukuwajutsu[/i] (腹話術) is literally translated as "belly talking" due to the early misconceptions of ventriloquists voluntarily producing their voices through their bellies in the same manner as a stomach growl, when ventriloquism is still in fact normal talking but with a bit of misdirection provided by the use of a prop.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Ventriloquism":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ventriloquism]

title: deutsche_tourenwagen_masters
body:
A German [[car]] [[racing]] motorsports series. Originally ran from 1984 to 1996 as [b]Deutsche Tourenwagen Meisterschaft[/b], the current incarnation of DTM began in 2000.

While DTM's original incarnation raced touring cars, the revived series was notable for its Class 1 [[racecar]]s, which were silhouette racers loosely based on production cars, similar to [[Super GT]]'s GT500 class. In 2021 the series switched to GT3-spec machinery to attract new manufacturers, no longer requiring them to develop a new racecar for a single series.

title: seitei_jujiryou
body:
Lit. "Holy Emperor Cross Masoleum". Localized in English as "Holy Cross Pyramid".

A prominent star-shaped [[pyramid (structure)|pyramidial]] monument from [[Hokuto no Ken]], ordered to be built by [[Souther]] as a shrine for his deceased master Ohgai. It was built using children [[slave]] labour, as Souther believes that their "pure soul" will not defile the "sacred" place.

[spoiler]Notable as the site where [[Shu (hokuto no ken)|]] was brutally tortured and executed by Souther. In which Shu was forced to carry the apex stone to the top of the pyramid with his crippled legs, then being impaled by hail of arrows and a javelin thrown by Souther once he reaches the top, and finally being crushed by the apex stone he carried.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]The site was partially destroyed in the aftermath of the final battle between [[Kenshiro]] and Souther, where the latter embraced his deceased master's body after receiving fatal blow by Kenshiro to repent his sins as the pyramid collapses.[/spoiler]

title: m50_reising
body:
The [b]M50 Reising[/b] is an [[united states|American]] .45 ACP [b][[submachine gun]][/b] that was developed in 1940. During [[World War II]], it was adopted into service with the [[united states navy|US Navy]] and [[united states marine corps|Marine Corps]] at the end of 1941. The Reising soon proved itself to be a difficult to use [[weapon]] due to its complicated closed-bolt design that jammed frequently in combat conditions if not cleaned frequently. It was withdrawn from service by 1943.

As a variant, the M55 Reising has a folding wire stock and a pistol grip instead of conventional one-piece wooden [[rifle]] stock.

h1. See also
* [[List of weapons]]
* [[M1 Carbine]]

title: first_battle_of_el_alamein
body:
[b]The First Battle of El Alamein[/b] (1–27 July 1942) was a battle of the Western Desert campaign of [[World War II]], fought in [[Egypt]] between Axis ([[germany|German]] and [[italy|Italian]]) forces of the Panzer Army Africa—which included the [[Afrika Korps]] under Field Marshal [[Erwin Rommel]]— and Allied ([[united_kingdom|British Imperial]] and Commonwealth) forces of the Eighth Army under General "Claude Auchinleck":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Claude_Auchinleck .

The British prevented a second advance by the Axis forces into Egypt. Axis positions near El Alamein, only 106 km (66 mi) from Alexandria, were dangerously close to the ports and cities of Egypt, the base facilities of the Commonwealth forces and the Suez Canal. However, the Axis forces were too far from their base at Tripoli in Libya to remain at El Alamein indefinitely, which led both sides to accumulate supplies for more offensives, against the constraints of time and distance. The first battle of El Alamein officialy ended in a stalement.

This battle and the [[Second Battle of El Alamein]] three months later remain important to some of the countries that took part. In [[New Zealand]], this is due to the country's significant contribution to the defense of El Alamein, especially the heavy role the Māori Battalion played. Members of this battalion have been labelled war heroes since, such as commander Frederick Baker, James Henare and Eruera Te Whiti o Rongomai Love, the last of whom was killed in action.
other_names: エル・アラメインの戦い

title: looping_animation
body:
An [[animated|animation]] where the start and end blend seamlessly together to create the illusion of a never-ending animation with no beginning or end.
Note that an obvious fade between the start and end, or a fade to black/white are not seamless transitions.

h4. Examples

* post #2126657 - A looping animation because the start and the end of the animation are identical.
* post #2083043 - Not a looping animation because it has a distinct beginning and end.

title: iwi_jericho_941
body:
The IWI Jericho 941 is an Israeli-made handgun that was first introduced in 1990. It is based upon the famous [[CZ 75]] pistol, and in addition to firing 9mm ammunition was originally designed to fire the .41 Action Express cartridge, which did not prove to be too popular, and enjoyed greater success when it was rechambered for the .40 S&W cartridge. The Jericho is used by Israeli police and military forces, as well as various other police and military agencies around the world, and in the US is sold by Magnum Research as the Baby Eagle.

[[Spike Spiegel]] of [i][[Cowboy Bebop]][/i] uses a Jericho as his weapon of choice.

title: usada_kensetsu
body:
("Usada Construction", as in a construction firm)

The name that [[hololive]] member [[Usada Pekora]] informally attached to to large-scale or complex projects that she built in [[Minecraft]]. Later became slightly more formalized with the fortunate [s][[akukin kensetsu|headhunting]][/s] [[hey moona|recruitment]] of [[hololive indonesia|hololiveID]]'s [[Moona Hoshinova]] (despite a severe language barrier).

Use this tag for pictures depicting:
* the UsaKen logo
* Group shots of all or most UsaKen members (Changes depending when the image was drawn)
* One or more members working on a project, usually in Minecraft
* One or more members in construction attire (often a [[hard hat]] and carrying a [[pickaxe]])

h3. Current members
* [[Usada Pekora]] (president)
* [[Moona Hoshinova]] (VP, manager)
* [[Takanashi Kiara]] (employee, foreign branch)
* [s][[Kiryu Coco]][/s] (former employee)
* [s][[Amane Kanata]][/s] (former part-timer, left the group on May 16, 2022)
* [[Shishiro Botan]] (contract employee)
* [[Tokoyami Towa]] (employee)
* [s][[Uruha Rushia]][/s] (former employee)


h4. See also

* [[List of hololive units and subgroups]]

("Akukin Construction", as in a construction firm)

The name that [[hololive]] member [[Minato Aqua]] began to use (in the vein of [[Usada Kensetsu]]) when referring to complex projects and structures built by her in [[Minecraft]]. Later recruited fellow hololivers [[Houshou Marine]], and (briefly) [[Moona Hoshinova]], jokingly went out of business during one of Aqua's extended breaks with many members leaving for other groups.

The group's Minecraft [[pixel art]] poster is a pixel art of Aqua herself on a [[white background]] with the name [b]AKUKIN Corporation[/b] and the group logo on the bottom.

Use this tag for pictures depicting:
* the Akukin logo
* Group shots of all or most Akukin members (Changes depending when the image was drawn, may or may not be coterminous with [[Umisea]])
* One or more members working on a project, usually in Minecraft
* One or more members in construction attire (often a [[hard hat]] and carrying a [[pickaxe]]).

title: naked_snake
body:
A main character from the [[metal_gear_(series)|Metal Gear]] stealth action [[video game]] series published by [[Konami]]. [b]Naked Snake[/b] is the protagonist of [[Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater]]. He also appears in its sequels [[Metal Gear Solid: Portable Ops]], [[Metal Gear Solid: Peace Walker]], [[Metal Gear Solid V: Ground Zeroes]] and [[Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain]].


[spoiler]Was given the title [[Big Boss]] for killing his mentor, [[The Boss]], who supposedly betrayed the United States for the Soviet Union.[/spoiler]

title: metal_gear_solid_v:_the_phantom_pain
body:
[b]Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain[/b] (メタルギアソリッドV ザ・ファントム・ペイン) is a [[video game]] from the [[Metal Gear (series)|]] stealth action game series published by [[Konami]]. It was released in 2015. It would be the last Metal Gear game in the series to be directed, written, and designed by [[Kojima Hideo]].

Combined with [[Metal Gear Solid V: Ground Zeroes]], the prologue and initial part of Metal Gear Solid V, it is the eighth and ninth entry in the series. It is the first to have an open world gameplay structure. It used the then-new multi-platform and open world [i]Fox[/i] game engine developed by Kojima Productions, which would be used for few games afterwards, mainly Pro Evolution Soccer. The game's been released for the PC, and the [[PlayStation 3]], [[Xbox 360]], [[PlayStation 4]] and [[Xbox One]] home consoles.

h4. See also

* [[Naked Snake]]
* [[Venom Snake]]
other_names: メタルギアソリッドVザ・ファントム・ペイン

title: volkshalle
body:
The [b]Volkshalle[/b] ([i]"People's Hall"[/i]), also called [b]Große Halle[/b] ([i]"Great Hall"[/i]) or [b]Ruhmeshalle[/b] ([i]"Hall of Glory"[/i]), was a proposal for a monumental, [[dome]]d [[building]] to be built in a reconstituted [[Berlin]] (renamed as [i]"Germania"[/i]) in [[Nazi]] [[Germany]]. 

The project was conceived by [[Adolf Hitler]] and designed by his architect "Albert Speer":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albert_Speer . No part of the building was ever constructed.

title: me!me!me!_dance_(meme)
body:
A particular dance shown in [[Me!Me!Me!]], an animation music video by TeddyLoid x [[daoko]] x Studio khara. The dance in question is the one shown at the timestamps 0:49 and 1:02 of the following Youtube video "here":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K5z_ORDgDDk]. (reference post: post #1852792)

The Me!Me!Me! dance involves the person in question swaying their hips from side to side while having their [[arms behind head|arms behind their heads]], optionally showing their [[armpits]].

The dance from the music video regained popularity in 2021, when an animation (post #4789699) of [[Zero Two (darling in the franxx)|]] performing it went viral on TikTok. This second wind set the dance to a different song ("2 Phut Hon (KAIZ Remix)":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yoZy2E17-50]).

This resulted in the dance being infamously misattributed by many as the "Hip Sway Dance" or the "Zero Two Dance".

title: battle_of_france
body:
[b]The Battle of France[/b] (French: [i]bataille de France[/i]) (10 May – 25 June 1940), also known as [b]the Western Campaign[/b] (German: [i]Westfeldzug[/i]), [b]the French Campaign[/b] (German: [i]Frankreichfeldzug[/i], French: [i]campagne de France[/i]) and [b]the Fall of France[/b], was the [[germany|German]] invasion and subsequent occupation of [[France]] during [[World War II]]. 

France and the Low Countries were conquered by [[Nazi]] Germany, ending all major Allied land operations on the Western Front until their [[invasion_of_normandy|Normandy landings]] 4 years later.

h4. See also

* [[Dunkirk Evacuation]]

title: imperial_japanese_army
body:
Posts containing references to the real life Imperial Japanese Army, such as depictions of historical events, [[military vehicle]]s, or [[soldier]]s with clear evidence of the colors or uniforms of Imperial [[Japan]].

h4. History
The Imperial Japanese Army (IJA) was the army of the Empire of Japan from 1871 to 1945. It was involved in several wars throughout the late 19th and early 20th century, including Russo-Japanese war, both Sino-Japanese wars, and [[World War II]].

The IJA became infamous throughout the world during 30s and 40s due to their countless war crimes and atrocities commited during the [[Second Sino-Japanese War]] and other conflicts in Asia (including but not limited to: cannibalism, large-scale rape, mass-murder, use of chemical and biological weapons, "forced human experimentation on captured civilians":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unit_731 , guerillas, and murder and torture of prisoners of war) committed during this time period (especially during the rule of [[toujou_hideki|Hideki Tojo]].) With some even suggest them to be even worse than the [[Nazi]] Germany regime itself.

Following the Japanese surrender, the IJA was dissolved and during 1950s its role as Japan's military's land warfare branch was taken over by the [[Japan Ground Self-Defense Force]] which was modeled after the US Army.

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: Imperial Japanese Army":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Imperial_Japanese_Army

A fictional [[mecha]] from [[Metal Gear (series)]].

It first appeared in the [[Metal Gear Solid: Peace Walker]] portable [[video game]] for the Sony [[PlayStation Portable]]. 

It is considered the first true Metal Gear combat [[walker (robot)|]] ever created.

title: metal_gear_(robot)
body:
The titular fictional manned [[walker (robot)|]] [[mecha]] from the [[Metal Gear_(series)|]] series.

"[b]METAL GEAR[/b] was the designation given to various models of bipedal [[tank]]s. They were behemoth machines capable of decimating lesser machines. Metal Gear had the distinction of being [[nuclear_weapon|nuclear]] capable, [[firing]] warheads from their [[railgun]], eliminating the need for a [[missile]], or launchpad allowing them to attack targets from anywhere in the world, on any kind of terrain. This peaked with [[Metal Gear REX]] which was sophisticated enough to launch a nuke and hit a target from anywhere in the world. REX also had the distinction of being completely untraceable."

h1. List of Metal Gears
* [[Metal Gear EXCELSUS]]
* [[Metal Gear GANDER]]
* [[Metal Gear RAXA]]
* [[Metal Gear RAY]]
* [[Metal Gear REX]]
* [[Metal Gear Sahelanthropus]]
* [[Metal Gear ZEKE]]
* [[Peace Walker (mecha)|]]
* [[Shagohod]]
* [[TX-55 Metal Gear]]
** [[Metal Gear D]]

h1. See also

* [[Gekko (metal_gear)|]]
* [[Metal Gear Mk. II]]

title: metal_gear_ray
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from [[Metal Gear (series)]]. 

It is an amphibious combat [[walker (robot)|]] originally designed by the United States Marine Corps to counter the [[Metal Gear REX]] clones that spread all over the world. The original was stolen by the Patriots onboard the USS Discovery in 2007 during the events of [[Metal Gear Solid 2: Sons Of Liberty]].

A redesigned unmanned model was produced by the US Navy and the Patriots in 2009.

title: little_shon_(battle_of_titans)
body:
[b]R2L1 "Little Shon"[/b] is a [[walker (robot)|]] style [[mecha]] appears in game [[battle_of_titans|Battle of Titans]]. It is a light-class bipedal Titan with the ability to jump.

Has a rare Martian version (R2L1M1) of itself, coloured in black.

title: battle_of_titans
body:
[b]Battle of Titans (B.o.T)[/b] is a 3rd person mech shooter game developed by the Russian game developer Red Button LLC. It was first released on iOS in 2014 and released on Android the following year. The game features walker-style battle machines (Titans) with exchangeable weapons and customizable stats.

The game was celeberated as the spritual successor of mobile mech shooter [[War_Robots|Walking War Robot]] as the development team consists of former Pixonic employees. The game however suffered an ICO funding failure and is ill-famed for its slow development speed.

Fan art of the title primarily consists of depiction of the game's [[mecha]], frequently [[personification|personified]] as [[mecha_musume|Mecha Musume]].

h5. List of Mechs (Titans)
[[little_shon_(battle_of_titans)|R2L1 "Little Shon"]]
[[Bully_(battle_of_titans)|R2L2 "Bully"]]
[[Mite_(battle_of_titans)|R4L1 "Mite"]]
[[Ravager_(battle_of_titans)|R2M1 "Ravager"]]
[[nelly_(battle_of_titans)|R6M4 "Nelly"]]
[[M.A.O._(battle_of_titans)|R2M3 "M.A.O."]]
[[cormorant_(battle_of_titans)|R2M2 "Cormorant"]]
[[tirpitz_(battle_of_titans)|R2H2 "Tirpitz"]]
[[atlas_(battle_of_titans)|R2H1 "Atlas"]]

h5.Tagging Notes
* Most Titans fits under the the [[walker (robot)|]] category, except [[atlas_(battle_of_titans)|Atlas]] which has arms.
* [[Mite_(battle_of_titans)|Mite]] and [[nelly_(battle_of_titans)|Nelly]] are also considered [[spider_tank]].
* Tag [[cormorant_(battle_of_titans)|Cormorant]] as [[aircraft]] in its flying state where its legs collapsed and thrusters out.
* [i]Tormentor[/i] is a [[railgun]]. [i]Vulcan[/i] is a [[multishot_rocket_launcher]]. [i]Cyclone[/i] is an [[autocannon]].

title: roiquonmi

title: quamzin_kravshera
body:
An antagonist character from the [[MACROSS]] series. 

He first appeared in the [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] TV series from 1982 and also appears in the [[Macross: Do You Remember Love?]] movie adaptation from 1984. 

[b]Quamzin Kravshera[/b] is a brilliant -but mentally unstable- [[Zentradi]] commander known as "The Ally Killer" for his very aggressive and unorthodox tactics that usually involve destroying both the enemies and his own men.

His [[mecha]] of choice are the [[Roiquonmi]] [[Glaug]] officer [[walker (robot)|]] and the [[Flemenmik]] [[Nousjadeul-Ger]] [[power armor]]. Quamzin is also in command of a [[Queadol-Magdomilla]] class battleship.

Quamzin's name was changed to [b]Quamzin 03350[/b] in the [i]Do You Remember Love?[/i] anime film and to [b]Khyron[/b] in the [[ROBOTECH]] American adaptation.

title: metal_gear_mk._ii
body:
メタルギアMk-Ⅱ ([b]Metal Gear Mk. II[/b]) is a small navigator/helper robot that appears in the [[Konami]] video game [[Snatcher]].

Originally, a [[walker (robot)|]] [[mecha]] named "[[TX-55 Metal Gear]]" appeared in the game [[metal_gear_(series)|Metal Gear]] sold on the MSX2, and in the story of [[Snatcher]], the Mk.II's design was based on this weapon.

The canon history of the [[metal_gear_(series)|Metal Gear]] series and the history the [[Snatcher]] story is set in have several common elements, such as the TX-55, and Dr. Pettrovich, who developed it, but it should be noted that they are basically two different worlds. ([[Metal Gear Solid]] makes it clear that the catastrophic biohazard outbreak that occurs during the 90s in the history of the Snatcher does not occur in the world of the Metal Gear series.)

In [[Metal Gear Solid 4: Guns Of The Patriots]], a non-AI "Metal Gear Mk. II" and "Mk. III" as created by [[hal_emmerich|Otacon]] make an appearance, but these radio controlled machines were intended as an homage to "Kojima Hideo,":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hideo_Kojima the game director of Snatcher and the original Metal Gear. Other than an homage, they are not connected to the above mentioned [[robot]] in any way.

title: ishfon
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] of [[choujikuu_seiki_orguss|The Super Dimension Century Orguss]] TV series.

The [b]Ishfon[/b] is a small [[Chiram]] combat [[walker (robot)|]] designed specifically for reconaissance missions. It is light armored and armed but is equipped with an advanced sensor array and detection equipment.

It was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] in the early 80s.

title: dreadnought_(warhammer_40k)
body:
"Even in death, I still serve!"

A type of bipedal [[walker (robot)|walking tank]] used by the [[Adeptus Astartes]] in [[Warhammer 40k]]. Marines who have been mortally wounded but are considered too valuable to lose are placed within these boxy, heavily-armed walkers so that they may continue to render service to their chapter and the [[imperium_of_man|Imperium]] as a whole.

title: metal_gear_1
body:
[b][i]Metal Gear[/i][/b] is an overhead military action-adventure [[video game]] originally released in 1987 by [[Konami]] for the [[MSX]]2 computer in Japan and parts of Europe. 

Players control [[Solid Snake]], an operative of the special forces unit FOXHOUND, who goes on a solo infiltration mission into the fortified state of Outer Heaven to destroy the [[TX-55 Metal Gear]], a [[walker (robot)|]] [[mecha]] tank capable of launching nuclear missiles from anywhere in the world, as well as rescue a number of fellow agents who have been captured by the enemy.

It is considered the first game ever to popularize the stealth game genre, and it also was the first video game to be fully developed by [[Kojima Hideo]], who would go on to direct most of the games in the [[Metal Gear (series)|]] franchise. 

A reworked port of the game was released for the [[Famicom]] a few months later, which later saw release in international markets for the NES over the following two years; this version was developed without Kojima's involvement and features drastically altered level designs, among other changes. This first game in the series was a major international success, with the [[NES]] version selling 1 million units in the United States alone. 

An emulated Famicom version came with the special edition of [[Metal Gear Solid|Metal Gear Solid: The Twin Snakes]] on the [[GameCube]]. A more faithful port of the MSX2 version was later included in the [[Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater|Metal Gear Solid 3: Subsistence]] game for the [[PlayStation 2]], as well as in the HD Edition of the same game released for the [[PlayStation 3]], [[Xbox 360]] and [[PlayStation Vita]], with these newer ports featuring a revised translation and additional gameplay features. The MSX version was also released for [[Wii]] Virtual Console and PC.

title: mad_cat_(battletech)
body:
A fictional [[walker (robot)|]] combat [[mecha]].

The [b]Mad Cat[/b] is a Clan OmniMech from the [i][[BattleTech]][/i] game setting. 

Properly known as a [i]Timber Wolf[/i], it was nicknamed [i]Mad Cat[/i] in its initial fictional appearances because it was first seen within the story by Inner Sphere MechWarriors, who were unaware of the existence of the Clans or their advanced 'Mechs until that point and didn't know the enemy units' proper names. 

Those who survived the initial encounters dubbed this model [i]Mad Cat[/i] because it resembles an earlier [i]Catapult[/i] BattleMech with the arms of a [i]Marauder[/i] (manufacturer designation MAD-3R).

title: variable_glaug
body:
In the [[MACROSS]] franchise, a [[Zentradi]] [[alien]] one-man command aerospace [[walker (robot)|]] [[mecha]]. It first appeared in the [i][[Macross M3]][/i] [[video game]] released for the [[SEGA Dreamcast]] console in 2001.

The [[Roiquonmi]] [b]Variable Glaug[/b] walker is a better and more advanced version of the traditional [[Glaug]]. It is able to transform into a fighter mode that is similar in performance to the version of the Glaug equipped with an aerospace booster.

title: bully_(battle_of_titans)
body:
[b]R2L2 Bully[/b] is a [[walker (robot)|]] style [[mecha]] appears in game [[battle_of_titans|Battle of Titans]].

Bully is [i]received as[/i] the fastest ground unit in gme, at the same time being the most fragile one due to exceptionally low defense. It is also the only Titan that can equip a shield.

title: m.a.o._(battle_of_titans)
body:
[b]R2M3 M.A.O.[/b] is a [[walker (robot)|]]-styled [[mecha]] ([i]Titan[/i]) appeared in game [[battle_of_titans|Battle of Titans]]. It is a medium-class Titan capable of mounting three medium weapons simultaneously.

Though likely being a translation error, its full name [i]Mechanized Assault Orgasm[/i] has led to speculations that the mech is actually a [[cyborg]]. With that being said, only use the tag [[cyborg]] if depicted as one.

It has a special skinned variant known as the M.A.O. [i]Cyclops[/i]. The paid skin had an infamous bug that halves its own defense abilities.

title: thurvel-salan
body:
A fictional massive [[alien]] [[spacecraft]] from the [[Macross]] series.

The [b]Thurvel-Salan Class Battleship[/b] is the primary combat vessel of the [[Zentradi]] war machine. 

Built in the latter era of the [[Protoculture]] Stellar Republic and used extensively during the Schism War thousands of years ago, the Thurvel-Salan's impressive design and functionality guaranteed a long service life. 

This 2.3 km spaceship features numerous beam and missile weapon emplacements all along the craft and the practical wedge-shaped hull enables the Thurvel-Salan to bring to bear the maximum number of energy guns possible against a target vessel at nearly any angle. 

In addition to its impressive firepower, the Thurvel-Salan also carries numerous [[Regult]] [[walker (robot)|]] [[mecha]], [[Gnerl]] fighter Pods and Re-entry ships for transporting land-based mecha to the surface of an enemy [[planet]]. 

This ship was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] in the early 80s.

title: gekko_(metal_gear)
body:
Type of small bipedal [[walker (robot)|]]s from the [[Metal Gear_(series)|]] series.

"Gekko was an unmanned autonomous fighting vehicle developed by AT Corp for use in ground combat. Officially designated IRVING by the United States Army, Gekko were colloquially called "lizards" after the species of small lizard with a similarly spelled name: gecko. These war machines were created using a combination of technologies used in the production of [[metal_gear_(robot)|Metal Gears]] [[metal_gear_rex|REX]] and [[metal_gear_ray|RAY]]. However, Gekko were not Metal Gears. Unlike true Metal Gears, Gekko had no [[nuclear_weapon|nuclear]] launch capability. Instead, they were more akin to infantry fighting vehicles, with multiple units acting as a coordinated team in support of ground forces."

title: ishkick
body:
A fictional enemy [[mecha]] from [[choujikuu_seiki_orguss|The Super Dimension Century Orguss]] TV series.

The [b]Ishkick[/b] is a heavily armed combat [[walker (robot)|]] that is the main combat mecha unit of the [[Chiram]] military. 

The Ishkick is a slow but highly maneuverable and well armored mecha. It is armed with several [[rocket launcher]]s, [[energy gun]]s and a powerful beam cannon above its cockpit.

In [[real life]] it was designed by [[Miyatake Kazutaka]] in the early 80s.

title: cormorant_(battle_of_titans)
body:
[b]R2M2 Cormorant[/b] is a [[walker (robot)|]] style [[mecha]] ([i]Titan[/i]) appears in game [[Battle_of_titans|Battle of Titans]]. It is a medium-class bipedal Titan with two collapsed thrusters, which when expanded, transforms itself into an [[aircraft]]. It has subpar ground mobility and is required to stay airborne most of the time.

Although it is designed to be an aerial support unit, one popular way of piloting the Cormorant involves closing the gap before landing suicidal attack on the enemy. The tactic is commonly referred as [i][[kamikaze_pilot|Kamikaze]][/i] amongst the English-speaking community.

title: ots-14_groza
body:
The [b]OTs-14 "Groza"[/b] (ОЦ-14 “Гроза”) is a Russian [[bullpup]] [b][[assault rifle]][/b] designed in early 1990s and manufacture started in 1994 by TsKIB SOO. Designed after the [[AKS-74U]], it was intended for [[Spetsnaz]] use. Three common variants exist; one is chambered in subsonic 9×39mm cartridge, and there are ones chambered in 7.62×39mm (accepts [[kalashnikov rifle|AK]] magazines) and 5.45×39mm. The pistol grip and trigger assembly can be replaced with an alternate trigger module with an integral [[GP-25]] grenade launcher. The short barrel accepts either a [[suppressor]] or an extension with an integral [[foregrip]].

* [[List of Weapons]]

title: midway_(movie)
body: A 2019 movie about the [[Battle of Midway]] during [[World War II]].

title: battle_of_midway
body:
The [b]Battle of Midway[/b] was a major naval battle in the Pacific theater of [[World War II]] that took place on 4-7 June 1942. 

The [[United States Navy]] managed to score a decisive [[victory]] against the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] by sinking four aircraft carriers ([[akagi_(aircraft_carrier)|Akagi]], [[kaga_(aircraft_carrier)|Kaga]], [[hiryuu_(aircraft_carrier)|Hiryuu]] and [[souryuu_(aircraft_carrier)|Souryuu]]) along with several well-trained pilots. These losses proved crucial for the outcome of the war as [[Japan]] was never able to fully replace the ships, the planes and the skilled pilots it needed to win the conflict. 

Thus this battle would become the turning point of the Pacific theater of WWII.

h4. See also
* [[Midway (movie)]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Midway]

title: shin_taketori_monogatari_sennen_joou
body:
[b]Shin Taketori Monogatari Sennen Joou[/b] (新竹取物語 1000年女王, [i]"The New Tale of the Bamboo Cutter: Millennium Queen"[/i]) is a [[science fiction]] manga series by [[Matsumoto Leiji]] which was serialized from 28 January 1980 through 11 May 1983 in both the Sankei Shimbun and Nishinippon Sports newspapers. 

The manga series was adapted into a 42-episode anime television series by Toei Dōga and broadcast on the Fuji TV network from 16 April 1981 through 25 March 1982. An anime film was released on 13 March 1982 shortly before the TV series ended.

The anime series was combined by Harmony Gold and Carl Macek (creators of [[ROBOTECH]]) with episodes from the 1978 Matsumoto series, [[uchuu kaizoku captain harlock|Space Pirate Captain Harlock]], and shown from 1985 to 1986 in the United States as the 65-episode [b]Captain Harlock and the Queen of a Thousand Years[/b]. 

The series was also broadcast in Mexico and Latin America during the 80s with the title "La Princesa de los Mil Años" ([b]The Thousand Year Princess[/b]). It was broadcast in Germany on Tele 5 during 1992, and on New Channel in Greece in 1997 and on Mangas in France in 2004.

h4.See also

* [[Yukino Yayoi]]
* [[Amamori Hajime]]
* [[Larela]]

h4.External links

* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Queen_Millennia

title: saiga_semi-automatic_rifle
body:
The [b]Saiga[/b] are a family of [[kalashnikov rifle|AK]]-based Russian semi-automatic [[rifle]]s manufactured by Kalashnikov Concern. Intended for civilian markets, it comes in various calibers such as the Saiga 223 (223 Remington/5.56×45mm) and Saiga 308 (.308 Winchester/7.62×51mm).
Due to regional legal restrictions, some models lack the pistol grip and opt for traditional semi-grip stock instead.

h1. See also

title: tube_pan
body: A tube pan, tube cake pan, or angel food cake pan is a type of [[cake pan]] that is donut-shaped with a central indent.  It has relatively straight sides and a flat bottom, unlike the curved sides and rounded/narrow bottom of a bundt pan.  They're used for baking airy cakes such as [[angel food cake]], [[sponge cake]], and [[chiffon cake]].

title: ebisu_(mythology)
body: One of the [[Seven Lucky Gods]], Ebisu is associated with fishermen, merchants, and luck. He is often depicted holding a large red snapper, symbolizing good fortune. Ebisu is probably most well-known for being the mascot of [[Yebisu]] beer.

title: sr-3mp
body:
The [b]SR-3 Vikhr[/b] (СР-3 Вихрь) is a Russian 9×39mm compact [[assault rifle]]. It was developed at TsNIITochMash in the early 1990s and was manufactured in 1994. Heavily based on the [[AS Val]], but lacks an integral suppressor. 
The SR-3M is the further modernized version, which was later improved again into the SR-3MP that has additional mounting rails on the handguards.

title: honda_ra271
body:
Honda RA271, the predecessor of the RA270 prototype race car, marking it's debut in 1964 on the German Grand Prix's Nürburgring circuit.

The Honda RA271 was [[Honda|Honda's]] first ever Formula One racing car to enter a race along with being the first Japanese-built car ever to enter a round of the FIA [[formula_one |Formula One World Championship]]. 

The car was developed from the company's 1963 prototype, retrospectively designated as the RA270.

Only one RA271 was ever built. The car is currently on display in the Honda Collection Hall at the Twin Ring Motegi in Japan.

title: windbreaker
body:
A thin fabric [[jacket]] designed to resist wind chill and light rain.  It is usually of lightweight construction and characteristically made of a synthetic material. A windbreaker often uses elastic waistbands, and/or armbands, and a zipper to allow adjustments for the current weather conditions. It sometimes include a hood that may be removable and/or stowable.  They are primarily worn during the warmer seasons when wind or rain are expected, or as part of a layering strategy during colder seasons.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Windbreaker":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Windbreaker]

title: leo_natal_(umamusume)
body:
Anime-only [[Umamusume]] character.

[[Horse girl]]. Has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair|maroon-brown]] hair and [[aqua eyes|turquoise-colored eyes]]. Wears a [[blue hairband]] and a [[necklace]], decorated with a hexagonal ornament resembling a [[shield]] on each. She also wears a [[green bow|green]] [[ear bow]] on [b]her right ear[/b].

Like [[Kin'iro Ryotei_(umamusume)|]], Natal is not directly based on a real-life racehorse, but her name and color scheme are unambiguously references to [[Leo Durban (racehorse)|]]. In particular, Leo Durban is named after the South African city of Durban, which was historically also known as Port [b]Natal[/b].

h4. External links

* "Horse JP Keiba: Leo Durban":[https://horsejpkeiba.com/leo-durban/]
* "JBIS: Leo Durban":[https://www.jbis.jp/horse/0000214308/]

title: siege_of_tsingtao
body:
The siege of the [[German Empire|German]] port, Tsingtao (or Tsingtau) (Now Qingdao) in [[China]] during [[World War I]] by a joint force of [[United Kingdom|British]] and [[Imperial Japanese Army|Imperial]] [[Imperial Japanese Navy|Japanese]] forces with [[France|French]] naval support. This siege was the first encounter between Japanese and German forces, the first Anglo-Japanese operation of the war, and the only major land battle in the Asian and Pacific theatre during World War I.

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: Siege of Tsingtao":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siege_of_Tsingtao

title: paprika
body:
Paprika (パプリカ, Papurika) is a Japanese animated science fiction film, based on Yasutaka Tsutsui's 1993 novel of the same name, about a research psychologist who uses a device that permits therapists to help patients by entering their dreams.

The film was directed by [[Kon Satoshi|Satoshi Kon]], animated by Madhouse Studios, and produced and distributed by Sony Pictures Entertainment. The film's music was composed by Susumu Hirasawa, who also composed the soundtrack for Kon's award-winning film, Millennium Actress, and equally lauded television series, Paranoia Agent.

In [[Digimon Adventure]], Tailmon is the Partner Digimon of [[Yagami Hikari]].

Tailmon is referred to as [b]Gatomon[/b] in English and Spanish material.

title: shinshuu_maru_(kancolle)
body:
A [[Kantai Collection]] character based on the Japanese Imperial Army amphibious assault ship [i]Shinshuu Maru[/i].
Character design by [[Parsley-F]].

h4. Appearance
Shinshuu Maru has [[long_hair|long]] [[brown hair]] tied into [[twin_braids|a pair of braids]] and [[large breasts]]. She wears a [[black capelet|black]] [[hooded capelet]] worn over a [[black dress]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[boots]]. She is typically depicted with the [[hood up]]. Her [[machinery]] consists of a crane and a large ship deck with several smaller ships attached.

Her hooded appearance has led to some similarities with the later-released [[Sakamata Chloe]], as both were drawn by the same artist.

h4. Personality and history
While coming off as somewhat laid back, she does seem to bear a grudge against [[Mogami (kancolle)|]], whose torpedoes accidentally struck Shinshuu Maru during the "Battle of Sunda Strait":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Sunda_Strait while engaging [[Houston (Kancolle)|]] and [[Perth (Kancolle)|]], sinking Shinshuu Maru in the process (she was later salvaged and brought back into service). For decades, [[Fubuki (Kancolle)|]] was mistakenly blamed for the act before new research pointed to Mogami instead.

h4. History
The historical ship was commissioned on 15 November 1934 and sunk (for the second and final time) on 3 January 1945 by air attack.

h4. See Also
* [[list of Kantai Collection characters]]

h4. External Links
* "Wikipedia: IJN [i]Shinshuu Maru[/i]":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_amphibious_assault_ship_Shinshū_Maru

title: isuzu_(retrofit)_(azur_lane)
body:
The kai/retrofit form of [i][[Azur Lane]][/i]'s [[Isuzu (azur lane)|]], as seen in post #3876950. 

In her kai form, she noticeably ages up to a more mature body, including [[medium breasts|her breast size]]. Her new outfit consists of a [[black serafuku|black sailor]] [[crop top]] with a [[white sailor collar]] and an [[aiguillette]], [[black gloves]], [[suspenders]] holding her [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt]], [[black thighhighs]], [[black footwear|black]] knee-high [[boots]] with [[rudder footwear|rudder]] add-ons, [[peaked cap]], and [[long sleeves|long]] black sleeves that are partially detached to [[armpit peek|show her armpits]]. 

Her new [[rigging]] removes the bridge and foremast in favor of a third hull piece to her back that still contains several [[anti-aircraft gun]]s. Her two retained side rigs are organized so that her 127 mm twin mounts are now on the left and her [[torpedo tubes]] and more AA guns are to the right.

title: yura_kai_ni_(kancolle)
body:
The kai ni/second remodel form of [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s [[Yura (kancolle)|]], as seen in post #2765212. 

At kai ni, she wears the same uniform as [[Kinu kai ni (kancolle)|Kinu]] and [[Abukuma kai ni (kancolle)|Abukuma]] before her. The [[serafuku]] now consists of a short-sleeved [[black jacket]] over a beige top, a [[grey sailor collar]] and [[grey skirt|grey]] [[pleated skirt]], notably without shorts. She also now wears a [[red ribbon|red]] [[neck ribbon]] and [[black gloves|black]] [[partially fingerless gloves]], while retaining her [[boots]]. This remodel was officially teased on the cover of Comptiq's June 2017 issue (post #2719435), however in the preview she appears to wear bike shorts similar to Kinu and Abukuma's.

Yura's new [[rigging]] consists of a handheld 127 mm single mount with a landing ramp to her left side while retaining her two twin [[torpedo tubes]].

title: yaoyorozu_(studio)
body:
An animation studio, founded in 2013, as a daughter company of the production company Just Pro, its bosses being producers Terai Sadahiro and Fukuhara Yoshitada. Specialized in 3DCG animation, later scouting Ishidate Kotarou of [[gdgd Fairies]] fame and [[Tatsuki (irodori)|]] of doujin group [[irodori (irodoriginal)|]] later that year; those two alongside the producers being seen as the founders. 

The studio gained worldwide fame after the first season of [[Kemono Friends]], their first collaboration with doujin group irodori, which received critical acclaim despite the low budget that resulted into poor animation quality. After, according to [[Kadokawa]], reportedly mishandling the franchise's copyright in 2017, Tatsuki was removed as director of the anime, and soon after Yaoyozoru was terminated from the contract.

The studio later seceded to form a new company, 8million (a play on the literal meaning of Yaoyorozu) in early 2020. 

h4. List of animated works in chronological order

* [[Chokkyuu Hyoudai Robot Anime]]
* [[Tesagure! Bukatsu-Mono]]
* [[Minarai Diva]]
* [[Kemono Friends]] (Season 1)
* [[Keifuku-san]]
* [[Kemurikusa]]

title: mejiro_family_matriarch
body:
[tn]"Grandmother (Umamusume)", "Mejiro Family Grandmother"[/tn]

Unnamed supporting character from the [[Umamusume]] anime. Head of the Mejiro Family and presumptive grandmother of [[Mejiro McQueen (Umamusume)|]].

The Mejiro matriarch appears as an [[old woman|elderly woman]] with [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[light purple hair|light purple]] hair (same shade as [[Mejiro McQueen (Umamusume)|McQueen]]'s). She wears a wide-brimmed [[black headwear|black]] [[hat]] and dresses in black clothes with [[long sleeves|long]], flared-out sleeves.

Addressed to as "Grandmother" (obaa-sama) by McQueen.

The Mejiro matriarch shares some resemblance with Kitano Miya, the real-life former owner and chairman of Mejiro Farm (Mejiro Shouji Co Ltd). Mrs. Kitano was also affectionately referred to as "Granny Mejiro" by Japanese horse racing fans.

As [[Mejiro McQueen (Umamusume)|]]'s grandmother is canonically known to have won the Tenno Sho before, the matriarch is widely speculated to be a [[horse girl]] and a composite representation of both Kitano Miya and Mejiro Asama (grandsire to the [[Mejiro McQueen (racehorse)|real-life Mejiro McQueen]] and also former winner of the Tenno Sho). An alternative interpretation holds that the matriarch is human (no horse ears visible and the telephone in her office is sized for humans) and the Tenno Sho winner to be McQueen's [i]other[/i] grandmother.

h5. Associated characters

* [[Mejiro McQueen (Umamusume)|]]


h4. External links

* "JP Wikipedia: Kitano Miya":[https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%8C%97%E9%87%8E%E3%83%9F%E3%83%A4]
* "Japanese Bloodstock Information System: Mejiro Asama":[https://www.jbis.jp/horse/0000017015/]
* "Mitaiyomitai: Mejiro Grandmother (Umamusume)! Introducing the person and the horse she is based and modeled on":[https://mitaiyomitai.com/anime/post-28295/] [tn]Blog post is in Japanese.[/tn]

title: imperial_korean_flag
body:
The national flag of the [[Korean Empire]]. Serving as the basis for the [[South Korea|South Korean]] Flag, it established three central parts: a white rectangular background, a red and blue [[yin_yang|Taegeuk]], symbolizing balance, in its center, and four black trigrams selected from the original eight, one toward each corner. The difference between this one and the modern verison is darker colours and a thinner Taegeuk.

h4. See Also
[[South Korean Flag]]

title: maou_(lv1_maou_to_one_room_yuusha)
body:
Maou is a male character from the series [[lv1_maou_to_one_room_yuusha|Level 1 Demon Lord & One Room Hero]].  Their initial form and comment on Maou's neither region early in the series by their servant [[Zenia_(lv1_maou_to_one_room_yuusha)|]] indicate Maou's base gender as male.  As a demon lord though transformation is one of their primary skills and to fit into the human world they regularly take on a female human form and they do not have particular issue wearing girls clothing (outside of some complaints of wearing something too frilly or servant attire with maid clothing).

Maou is the demon lord who rules the demon races.  Having been defeated by the human hero Max, Maou vowed revenge and that they'd returned one day.  A decade later they returned, although not to their full power and stature but still very adamant to seeing what the hero has been up to in the last 10 years. Upon learning about Max's condition as an out of work homebody, they end up getting involve with Max's life and trying to help him.  Despite Maou's claims as being Max's adversary, they're very much a huge fan of Max and likely have some degree of a crush on him.

h6. Forms

* After resurrection: post #6563839 (may have butterfly wings with eyes)
* Human form: post #6545269

title: alice's_emotion
body:
Main circle of REDALiCE.

REDALiCE, formerly known as Akai Hito, is the founder of ALICE'S EMOTION and HARDCORE TANO*C. He is one of the most famous DJ's in the J-Core scene and had a major impact in the developement of new style J-Core.

His J-Core style mainly sticks to happier and uplifting hardcore techno, but sometimes even turns to harder and more aggressive variations, such as Gabber.

REDALiCE is not only a DJ producer, but also an anime and manga enthusiast. He is connecting his passion for anime and manga with the subject of his music.

ALiCE'S EMOTION, his home label, has it's main purpose in the publication of video game music arrangements and remixes, such as Touhou oriented J-Core. REDALiCE himself is very dedicated Touhou enthusiast.

HARDCORE TANO*C, on the other side, is his collaboration circle and has it's main purpose in the production and publication of original J-Core music. The publication of new releases is commonly done via live events, which take place in clubs. These events are so-called TANO*C STRIKES.

NISMO runs Nissan's factory effort in [[Formula E]] and developed [[racecar]]s for other series including the GT3 [[Nissan GT-R]], [[Super GT]] GT500 [[Nissan Z (RZ34)|]], and other previous racecars. body:

The [[weapon]] is identifiable by its sheet metal curved shoulder rest and a very large trigger guard that extends to the bottom of the pistol grip.

title: pm-84_glauberyt
body:
The [b]PM-84 Glauberyt[/b] or FB Glauberyt is a Polish [[submachine gun]], adopted in 1984. Unlike the earlier [[PM-63 RAK]], it utilizes an internal closed bolt mechanism instead of external reciprocating slide. The [[weapon]]  features handgun-like ergonomics, foldable [[vertical foregrip]], retractable stock, vertical charging handle knob and sheet metal rounded trigger guard.

This tag applies to any PM-84 variants such as the 9mm Parabellum PM-84P, or the more modern PM-06 with mounting rail on top.

h1. See also
* [[List of Weapons]]

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: FB Glauberyt":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FB_Glauberyt

title: italian_air_force
body:
Air force of [[Italy]]. Being one of the countries that adopted military aviation early, the air force acquired its own air component in 1884 and engaged in reconnaissance and bombing sorties during the Italo-Turkish War in 1911. Representing the first use of heavier-than-air aircraft in armed conflict.
Use this tag for images depicting its [[logo]], Italian [[aircraft]] or characters wearing the [[military uniform|uniform]].

h1. See also

title: infiniti_q70
body:
A luxury [[car|sedan]] produced by [[Infiniti (company)|]]. Debuted in 2010 as the [b]Infiniti M[/b] (of which it was the 5th generation), the name was changed in 2013 to reflect Infiniti's updated naming system. The model was discontinued in 2019 due to faltering sales and the American market's preference for SUVs and crossovers.

The Q70 is a rebadged version of two [[Nissan]] vehicles - the second generation [[Nissan Fuga]] and the fifth generation [[Nissan Cima]]. The main difference is that the Cima-based models are hybrids, and they are also slightly longer than the Fuga-based models.

title: mazda_787b
body: A Japanese [[le mans prototype|endurance race car]] that won the overall title at the [[circuit de la sarthe|24 Hours of Le Mans]] in 1991, becoming the first Japanese car and first rotary-engined car to do so. It is still the only rotary-engined car to achieve the feat and was the only Japanese car to have achieved such a result for 27 years, until Toyota won the 2018 and 2019 events with the [[Toyota TS050]] and the 2021 race with the [[toyota gr010|GR010]].

title: skoda
body: Former Czech industrial conglomerate mostly known today for its surviving automobile manufacturing subsidiary, Škoda Auto, which was established in 1925 after the purchase of Laurin & Klement, headquartered in Mladá Boleslav, Czech Republic. Became state-owned in 1948, and then privatized to [[Volkswagen]] from 1991 on. Known primarily for cheap and reliable automobiles.

title: czechoslovakia
body: A country in Central Europe, consisting of the [[Czech Republic]] and [[Slovakia]], which existed from roughly 1918 to 1992 (with a gap during World War II). Existed in two periods: the interwar period, when it also controlled a part of modern-day Ukraine, and the Cold War, when it was under [[Soviet]] influence as the Czechoslovak Socialist Republic.

In Japan, a collaboration was announced with [i][[Umamusume]][/i] featuring [[Mayano Top Gun (Umamusume)|]] (whose [[mayano_top_gun_(racehorse) |namesake horse]] was named after the movie, and also whose personality is similar to that of a pilot from the film) as a special advertising pilot, including replacing Cruise's [[Pete "Maverick" Mitchell]] in an alternate official Japanese movie poster (Post #5348482, published on Twitter by both [i]Umamusume[/i] and the movie's Japanese Twitter account).

title: m1941_johnson_lmg
body:
The [b]M1941 Johnson LMG[/b], or the Johnny gun, was an American recoil-operated [[light machine gun]] designed in the late 1930s by Melvin Johnson, chambered in .30-06 Springfield. It entered service in 1940 until 1961.
The [[weapon]] is recognizable by the side-mounted curved magazine, a [[bipod]], tubular [[barrel shroud]] with circular perforations, and a triangular front sight post.

title: damn_reincarnation
body:
Korean Manhwa/Novel of the same name.

Synopsis
The warrior Hamel went on an adventure with his companions to defeat the Demon Kings, but after dying just before the final battle with the Demon Kings…
“Waaah.”

‘What the fuck!’

He was reincarnated as the descendant of his fellow warrior, Vermouth.

Hamel — no, Eugene Lionheart was reborn with the blood of the Great Vermouth.

‘My previous body held enough talent to be mistaken for a genius, but this one… there’s just no comparison.’

With a body that had higher specs right from the start, he showed explosive growth that far surpassed what he had achieved in his previous life.

Along with the unknown reasons for his reincarnation came the uneasy reality of having to coexist with demons. He was faced with a world that made him question everything he had believed in.

Gifted with this extraordinary body since birth, as Eugene, he begins walking down the unfinished path from his previous life.

title: b&t_vp9
body:
The [B]B&T VP9[/b] (Veterinary Pistol 9mm) is an integrally-suppressed [[bolt action]] [[handgun]] manufactured by Brügger & Thomet since 2014. Heavily based on the earlier [[Welrod]], it has similar appearance due to the tubular upper receiver and L-shaped trigger. It also features a [[ported barrel]] and quick-detachable [[suppressor]].

Earlier models lack a trigger guard and has a manual safety, while newer models has a rounded thin sheet metal trigger guard and a grip safety instead.

h1. See also
* [[List of Weapons]]

h1. External links
* "IMFDb":https://www.imfdb.org/wiki/Brügger_%26_Thomet_VP9
* "Wikipedia: B&T VP9":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brügger_%26_Thomet_VP9

title: armalite_ar-7
body:
The [b]ArmaLite AR-7[/b] is an American .22 LR semi-automatic [[rifle]] designed by Eugene Stoner in 1958. It was originally intended to be an aircrew survival [[weapon]]. Being a takedown utility rifle, the [[gun]] can be quickly disassembled into three major parts: the buttstock, receiver, and barrel.

h1. See also
* [[List of Weapons]]

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: ArmaLite AR-7":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ArmaLite_AR-7

title: ots-38_stechkin
body:
The [b]OTs-38 Stechkin[/b] is a Russian 5-shot, double-action [[revolver]], in production and service since 2002, chambered in the special 7.62×41mm SP-4 ammunition. The cylinder is fed via full moon [[clip (weapon)|clips]]. The cartridge employs a captive piston, creating a gas seal, so there is no muzzle flash or loud gunfire sound upon discharge.

h1. See also
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[PSS silent pistol]]

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: OTs-38 Stechkin":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OTs-38_Stechkin_silent_revolver

body:

title: mp-155
body:

However, he was found alive in January 2018 and working as real estate dealer, currently going under the name "Danny Resko". title: yu-gi-oh!_sevens
body:
The seventh series and sixth spin-off of [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] anime. Produced by Studio Bridge. It was aired between April 4, 2020 to March 27, 2022. It primarily focus around [i][[Yu-Gi-Oh! Rush Duel|Rush Duel]][/i], a completely simplified version of the original card game for younger audience.

The anime is also notable for its significantly toned down dark story elements that the previous series were known for, in favor of a lighthearted comedy story for general audience.

title: pain_au_chocolat
body:
A pain au chocolat (literally "bread with chocolate") is a type of Viennoiserie pastry consisting of a cuboid-shaped piece of yeast-leavened laminated dough, similar in texture to a puff pastry, with one or two pieces of dark chocolate in the center. The chocolate usually has a slight bite to the texture.
Usually associated with France, its country of origin.

title: angela_(project_moon)
body:
Main character of two of [[Project Moon]]'s games.

In [[Lobotomy Corporation]], she is the AI helper of the Manager, whom the player controls. She has [[very long hair|long]] [[blue hair]] with [[one side up]], a notably [[large breasts|large-breasted appearance]] covered by a [[white coat|lab coat]], a [[black skirt|black]] [[pencil skirt]], a [[black vest]] (sometimes drawn as a jacket, seeing as there's no real way to tell whether it has sleeves or not), [[pantyhose]] and [[red footwear|red]] [[high heels]].
She often has her [[closed eyes|eyes closed]].

In [[Library of Ruina]], she undergoes a massive appearance change due to spoilery reasons.
Her hair turns [[short hair|short]], and her [[yellow eyes]] are now always open.
She swaps her previous office clothes for a new set of Librarian clothes.
She wears a [[blue coat]] with [[frilled sleeves|frills]], a [[white ascot]] with a [[brooch]] and [[black feathers|feather-like decorations]], a [[black skirt]] with a [[black vest]] and a [[white shirt]].
She's usually seen holding a [[book]] or surrounded by [[pages]] or [[bookshelf|bookshelves]].

[Spoiler]At the start of the game and during one of its bad endings, she wears a [[black dress]] that seems to be made up of feathers.[/spoilers]

During the events of the game, she resonates with various abnormalities gaining their [[E.G.O (project moon)|]], which looks and acts different from that of Lobotomy Corporation's.

title: floor_of_art's_glowing_creature
body:
A small, glowing creature that exists in [[Library of Ruina]]'s Floor of Art.
It doesn't seem to have a name, and it's uncertain whether it is an abnormality or not.

title: enkephalin_(project_moon)
body:
A green substance from the [[Project Moon]] series that is used as an energy source.
In [[Lobotomy Corporation]], it is the manager's job to extract it from interaction with abnormalities.
In [[Limbus Company]], [[Mephistopheles (project moon)|]]' engine can synthetize it from corpses, with the brain being the most efficient organ for this process.

In real life, this substance is an opioid, which is reflected in the series by having it be an addictive substance that quells pain.

title: netzach_(project_moon)
body:
One of the Sephirah that appears in [[Lobotomy Corporation]] and [[Library of Ruina]].
He has [[long hair|long]] [[green hair]], which is let down in LC and held up in a messy [[folded ponytail]] in LoR.
He originally wears a standard [[suit]] and [[green necktie|tie]] with a [[green armband]] which then turns to a [[green coat]] in Ruina, paired with a [[green ascot]] which he usually wears [[undone ascot|undone]].

[Spoiler]His original identity was [[Giovanni (project moon)|]].
In Lobotomy Corporation, he has an addiction to [[Enkephalin (project moon)|]], which is substituted by alcohol in Ruina.[/spoiler]

title: netzach's_painting
body:
A tall, green monster with a [[top hat]] and many eyes that appears in one of [[Netzach (project moon)|]]'s paintings in [[Library of Ruina]].

It appears to exist somewhere in the Floor of Art, being visible in the background of the fights that take place there, similar to the [[Floor of Art's glowing creature]].

title: vira_(granblue_fantasy)
body:
Playable female character in [[Granblue Fantasy]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] in a [[ponytail]] and [[orange eyes|orange]] [[empty eyes]]. She wears a [[short dress|short]] red and white dress, black thighhighs, [[brown footwear|brown]] [[lace-up boots]], and moderate armour. In the summer beach festival event she wears an elaborate white, black, and orange themed outfit being consisting of a bikini, criss-cross black thighhighs adorned with bows, and a [[hibiscus]] in her hair.

She can get [[yandere|a bit on the crazy side]].

title: battleship_(game)
body:
Table top guessing game for two players. Each player has two grids, one grid to place their "ships" (two to five squares in length), the other to "aim and shoot" at the opponent's ships using coordinates. A ship is "hit" once when it occupies a square called by the opponent and is "sunk" when all squares it occupies are hit. The object is to sink all of the opponent's ships before the opponent does the same.

Starting out as a pencil and paper game played as far back as the 1890s under the names [i]Baslinda[/i] and [i]L'Attaque[/i], it is best known in [[board game]] form with plastic game ship models and pegs on 10x10 grids, first produced by Milton Bradley in 1967.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battleship_(game)]
* "Complete rules (2002 version)":[http://www.hasbro.com/common/instruct/BattleShip_(2002).PDF]
* "Board Game Geek page":[http://www.boardgamegeek.com/game/2425]

h4.See also

* [[Battleship (movie)]]

title: luftwaffe
body:
The aerial warfare branch of the combined [[Wehrmacht]] military forces of [[Nazi]] [[Germany]] during [[World War II]]. It replaced the [[World War I|World War I-era]] Luftstreitkräfte ("Air Force") of the Army and the Marine-Fliegerabteilung ("Naval Aviation Department") of the Navy.

Note that this tag can also be applied to the modern air force of Germany, as it has also inherited the name "Luftwaffe" from its predecessor.

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: Luftwaffe":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Luftwaffe
* "Wikipedia: German Air Force":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/German_Air_Force

title: type_63_assault_rifle
body:
The [b]Type 63[/b] is a Chinese-designed 7.62×39mm [[assault rifle]] that externally resembles the [[SKS]]. It features a rotating-bolt system modified from the [[Type 56 assault rifle]] instead of the SKS tilting bolt one, a bottom-folding [[bayonet]] and can use removable AK magazines.

title: chasseurs_ardennais
body:
[i]"Résiste et Mords!”[/i] - (Resist and Bite!) Official motto

A [[belgium|Belgian]] infantry formation. Well known during the German invasion of Belgium, where they proved to be more successful than other units in their defense before the capitulation of Belgium.

It was created before [[World War II]] in 1933 to ensure the defense of Belgium's Luxembourg Province. Specifically the Ardennes region.

title: cnoc_na_riabh_(fate)
body:
A figure who appears in the Britain Lostbelt of [[Fate/Grand Order]]. She is the leader of the King Clan of Fae in the northern territory of Edinburgh in the Lostbelt, said to be the clan responsible for all of the world's discord and conflict. She greatly resembles [[Medb (fate)|]], and her name [i]Knocknarea[/i] refers to the hill in the Irish province of Sligo where Medb's Tomb is located. The English version uses the Irish name of the hill: [b]Cnoc na Riabh[/b].

h4.See also

* [[Cnoc na Riabh (Swimsuit Foreigner) (fate)|]]

title: furuido_yuuko
body: Furuido Yuuko is a character in [[Heybot!]], formed from a rejected design / alternate persona of [[Nejiyanagi Yuuko]].  As a result, she is always appears in [[monochrome]] even in otherwise colored scenes.  Like Nejiyanagi, she has [[black hair]] that [[one_eye_covered|covers one eye]], but hers is styled as a [[short_hair|short]] [[bob cut]].  She is meant to be the protagonist's childhood friend in high school, and as such, she wears a [[school uniform]] with a [[skirt]], [[blazer]], [[necktie]], [[white_shirt|white]] [[dress shirt]], [[black thighhighs]] and [[loafers]]. Later in the series she gains color and a faux broken Italian accent and becomes the character [[Vocamente Yuuko]].
